repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: This PR is enabler for introducing directive support in #6531 based on comment https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6531#issuecomment-2571616934.

comment_data.body: This caching I think needs to be done via some decorator...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -835,26 +840,47 @@ def use_cython_array_utility_code(env):
 
 is_contig_utility = load_memview_c_utility("MemviewSliceIsContig", context)
 overlapping_utility = load_memview_c_utility("OverlappingSlices", context)
-copy_contents_new_utility = load_memview_c_utility(
-    "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate",
-    context,
-    requires=[],  # require cython_array_utility_code
-)
-
-view_utility_code = load_memview_cy_utility(
-        "View.MemoryView",
-        context=context,
-        requires=[Buffer.buffer_struct_declare_code,
-                  Buffer.buffer_formats_declare_code,
-                  memviewslice_init_code,
-                  is_contig_utility,
-                  overlapping_utility,
-                  copy_contents_new_utility,
-                  ],
-)
+
+
+def _get_copy_contents_new_utility():
+    copy_contents_new_utility = load_memview_c_utility(
+        "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate",
+        context,
+        requires=[],  # require cython_array_utility_code
+    )
+    return copy_contents_new_utility
+
+_cached_nonshared_result = None

@@ -835,26 +840,47 @@ def use_cython_array_utility_code(env):

-                  ],
-)

+    copy_contents_new_utility = load_memview_c_utility(
+        "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate",
+        context,
+        requires=[],  # require cython_array_utility_code
+    )
+    return copy_contents_new_utility
+
+_cached_nonshared_result = None

comment_data.body: So, you created all these factory functions that replace the utility code constants with (apparently) fresh, constant copies of the utility code. And now you cache the creation to return always the same objects? What am I missing here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -835,26 +843,43 @@ def use_cython_array_utility_code(env):
 
 is_contig_utility = load_memview_c_utility("MemviewSliceIsContig", context)
 overlapping_utility = load_memview_c_utility("OverlappingSlices", context)
-copy_contents_new_utility = load_memview_c_utility(
-    "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate",
-    context,
-    requires=[],  # require cython_array_utility_code
-)
-
-view_utility_code = load_memview_cy_utility(
-        "View.MemoryView",
-        context=context,
-        requires=[Buffer.buffer_struct_declare_code,
-                  Buffer.buffer_formats_declare_code,
-                  memviewslice_init_code,
-                  is_contig_utility,
-                  overlapping_utility,
-                  copy_contents_new_utility,
-                  ],
-)
+
+
+def _get_copy_contents_new_utility():
+    copy_contents_new_utility = load_memview_c_utility(
+        "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate",
+        context,
+        requires=[],  # require cython_array_utility_code
+    )
+    return copy_contents_new_utility
+
+@Utils.cached_function
+def _get_memoryview_utility_code():

comment_data.body:
It's targeted at improving #6531.

It lets you generate memoryview code based on env (i.e. compiler directives rather than `Options`). So it's specifically aimed at making `shared_utility_code` as a directive.

But you're right that it achieves nothing on its own.

comment_data.body: I can prepare example branch integrating this PR with https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6531. I created this PR for easier review of the changes. If there is consensus that it should be all included in one PR I will gladly close this PR and integrate the changes to #6531.

commit.message:
Allow MemoryViews to be parametrized by compilator directives.

Co-authored-by: da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk>
